name: Eva Caldwell
cookingMethod: A stew is a combination of solid food ingredients that have been cooked in liquid and served in the resultant gravy. Ingredients can include any combination of vegetables and may include meat, especially tougher meats suitable for slow-cooking, such as beef, pork, venison, rabbit, lamb, poultry, sausages, and seafood

name: Jacquelyn Holland
ingredients: 4 cups mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes)
cookingMethod: Salisbury steak involves making seasoned beef patties using mince / ground beef, then making a mushroom gravy. In my recipe, there’s just two little things I do differently to the usual Salisbury Steak recipe that takes these up a notch

name: Mcmahon Stephens
ingredients: 2 racks of baby back ribs (about 4 lbs)
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 275°F (135°C).In a small bowl, mix together brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, salt, and black pepper to make a rub.Rub the spice mixture all over the ribs, making sure to cover both sides.Place the ribs on a baking sheet lined with foil, meaty side up.

name: Lesley Irwin
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
cookingMethod: Crack the eggs into a bowl, add milk, salt, and black pepper, and whisk together until well combined.Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.Add diced ham, green bell pepper, and onion to the skillet, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are tender and the ham is lightly browned.

name: Chaney Mosley
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray or butter.In a large bowl, whisk together cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt until well combined.In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, eggs, and melted butter until well combined.Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined (don't overmix).Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.

name: Karen Smith
cookingMethod: Crack the eggs into a bowl, add milk, salt, and black pepper, and whisk together until well combined. Ingredients can include any combination of vegetables and may include meat, especially tougher meats suitable for slow-cooking, such as beef, pork, venison, rabbit, lamb, poultry, sausages, and seafood
